page.title: 14 Trevathan Farm
page.content: There has been a farm here since before the{10th century.}The same family have been farming Trevathan since{1860.}Seven members of the family are living there now.They have a mixed farm of{100 hectares.}The land of the farm slopes southwards from approximately{120m}above sea level, to the north of the farmhouse, down to approximately{15m}in the valley below. They have 80 ewes, 60 young ewes, 20 small lambs, 2 pet lambs, 2 rams, 2 dairy cows and 25 beef cattle aged 6 months to 2 years.They have 2 tractors, a JCB excavator, a corn drill, a fertilizer sprayer, a corn blower, a roller and a cultivator.They have one employee and 2 working dogs. In 1985 the crops are peas, lupins, wheat and barley.The old stables have recently been converted into a summer holiday{self_catering}cottage.
